Surgery Journey

First Consultation

The first consultation establishes the trust relationship between the patient and the listening surgeon. Through this consultation I can identify your requests, your concerns, your expectations and your motivations.

It's the opportunity to gather information for the medical file (history, treatments...) and to perform a clinical examination so that I can offer you one or more medical or surgical care options.

Then I detail the procedure modalities, its advantages, disadvantages, limitations and complications.

At the end of the consultation, a complete file including an information sheet from the French Society of Plastic, Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgery, an informed consent as well as a detailed quote (surgeon and anesthesiologist fees, clinic fees) is given to you at the end of this first consultation if a personalized care project is considered.

Following this consultation: the decision is yours with all the information given to make your choice. A minimum reflection period of 15 days is mandatory.

Second Consultation

The second consultation takes place before the procedure after the mandatory reflection period.

It's the opportunity to answer the questions that came to you after the first consultation and to refine the surgical project.

Preoperative photographs of the surgical area (front, profile, three-quarters) are systematically taken.

At the end of the consultation, the administrative file is completed and I give you the prescriptions for before and after the surgical operation.

An anesthesia consultation must be scheduled at least 48 hours before the procedure.

The Surgical Procedure

The surgery takes place at the Villette Clinic in Dunkirk or at the Flandre Clinic in Coudekerque-Branche. You are hospitalized on the morning of the procedure.

Before entering the operating room, I make all the drawings and markings necessary for the surgery.

Discharge is either on the same day for outpatient procedures, or on day 1 or day 2 for procedures requiring hospitalization.

Post-operative Follow-up

Upon discharge: your file is completed with the hospitalization report and post-operative instructions and a follow-up consultation scheduled between 4 to 15 days after the procedure.

Post-operative follow-up is carried out by my medical office team and myself.

If you have any questions, you can reach me at docteur.woussen@gmail.com or Marie-Charlotte at secretariat.docteur.woussen@gmail.com or at 03 28 23 77 24.

Follow-up Consultations

Follow-up consultations are the opportunity to see each other again, to get news from you and to discuss your other requests or concerns.

Preoperative photographs of the surgical area (front, profile, three-quarters) are systematically taken.

Consultations take place at 3-6 months, and at 1 year.

Additional Information

Before the Procedure

  • An ultrasound +/- mammography is performed for all breast procedures.
  • A stable weight with a BMI <30 is required.
  • Stopping smoking is recommended 1 month before and after the procedure for quality healing and to reduce the risk of complications.

The Procedure and After

  • Procedures are performed under general anesthesia or local anesthesia. They can be performed as outpatient or followed by one or more nights of hospitalization.
  • A compression garment is worn day and night for at least one month.
  • Showers are allowed with bandages, if possible before the nurse's visit who will redo the bandage, until the first consultation.
  • Scar massages 2 times a day for 15 minutes, are started from 2 weeks (after the follow-up appointment) and for 6 months.
  • The scar must be protected from the sun for 2 years.
  • The scar is inflammatory, meaning red and painful between 2 to 4 months, which is normal in the healing process, then it will gradually whiten. It is stable and definitive after 2 years.
  • Swimming in a pool or sea water is prohibited before complete healing.
  • Driving is allowed from 8 days.
  • Sports practice is allowed at two months.
